newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Rizal Bank sees 1997 net at 1.626 bln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Rizal Bank sees 1997 net at 1.626 bln pesos.

text.p: Rizal Commercial Banking Corp said on Friday its 1997 net income is projected to grow by 39 percent to 1.626 billion pesos from 1.166 billion pesos last year.
In a disclosure to the Philippine Stock Exchange, it forecast its loan portfolio to grow by 15 percent to 56.762 billion pesos in 1997 from 49.226 billion pesos in 1996.
This will bring up its interest income to 8.375 billion pesos in 1997 from 7.036 billion pesos.
Total operating income is expected to reach 9.744 billion from 8.100 billion pesos in 1996.
The bank gave its 1997 earnings forecast since it is making a stock rights offering, the record date of which had been set for March 26, 1997.
A total of 50,632,900 shares will be offered at 40.30 pesos per share. One new share will be offered for every 7.551 common shares held, the bank statement said.
The offer period will start on March 26 and end on May 2, the bank said. The net proceeds of the offer will be used to fund the bank's lending activities.
